lessons.title: Welcome to Mecalin
lessons.description: Welcome to Mecalin, your typing tutor! This course will teach you touch typing step by step. You'll start with the home row keys and gradually learn all the keys on the keyboard. Take your time, practice regularly, and you'll become a proficient typist in no time!

lessons.title: First part of the home row
lessons.description: Learn part of the home row: A, S, D, K, L, ;

steps.description: Here begins the first lesson. Pay attention to errors to avoid repeating them. In this lesson you will learn the keys a, s, d, k, l, ;
Press the 'a' key with the pinky finger of your left hand

Don't forget to place your fingers on the home row and your thumbs on the spacebar. You should get used to adopting the correct position in all sessions. Press the ';' key with the pinky finger of your right hand
Look at the screen and not at the keyboard. Press the 's' key with the ring finger of your left hand and the 'l' key with the right hand

Now let's do some exercises with these 4 letters in the correct order. If there's any error in the line, it will have to be repeated. Don't be impatient if it doesn't work well the first time. Remember to press the spacebar between words

Now let's do some exercises with these 4 letters in the correct order. If there's any error in the line, it will have to be repeated. Don't be impatient if it doesn't work well the first time. Remember to press the spacebar between words

Now let's do some exercises with these 4 letters in the correct order. If there's any error in the line, it will have to be repeated. Don't be impatient if it doesn't work well the first time. Remember to press the spacebar between words

Now let's do some exercises with these 4 letters in the correct order. If there's any error in the line, it will have to be repeated. Don't be impatient if it doesn't work well the first time. Remember to press the spacebar between words
Now let's add two keys for the middle fingers; with the left hand the 'd' key and with the right the 'k'
Don't forget that the spacebar is pressed with the thumb of the hand opposite to the last key pressed
Don't forget that the spacebar is pressed with the thumb of the hand opposite to the last key pressed
Fingers should return to their position after pressing each key
Fingers should return to their position after pressing each key
Fingers should return to their position after pressing each key
Press the keys with the correct fingers, even if it seems slower now
Press the keys with the correct fingers, even if it seems slower now
Now the exercises must be repeated 2 times without errors to move to the next one
Now the exercises must be repeated 2 times without errors to move to the next one
Don't be impatient. Don't rush
You have finished the first lesson and done the first exercises

lessons.title: Home row
lessons.description: Learn the home row keys: A, S, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, ;

steps.description: Here begins the second lesson. We're going to learn the rest of the home row and do a series of exercises with it. Remember not to look at the keyboard, but at your computer screen
Press the 'f' key with the index finger of your left hand
Press the 'f' key with the index finger of your left hand and the 'j' key with your right hand
You must perform each exercise twice without errors to move to the next exercise
You must perform each exercise twice without errors to move to the next exercise
Watch the position of your fingers when finishing each keystroke
Watch the position of your fingers when finishing each keystroke
Are you pressing the spacebar with the appropriate thumb?
Are you pressing the spacebar with the appropriate thumb?
Don't look at the keyboard, only at your computer screen
Two more keys for the same fingers. With the index finger of your left hand the 'g' key and with your right hand the 'h'
Remember to maintain correct posture. Straight back, hands on the home row and thumbs on the spacebar. Continue with more exercises...
Remember to maintain correct posture. Straight back, hands on the home row and thumbs on the spacebar. Continue with more exercises...
Move only the index fingers, not the whole hand
Move only the index fingers, not the whole hand
Another key from this row "'". It's pressed with the pinky finger of your right hand, same as the ';' key, but remember not to move your hand, only the finger
Another key from this row "'". It's pressed with the pinky finger of your right hand, same as the ';' key, but remember not to move your hand, only the finger
Another key from this row "'". It's pressed with the pinky finger of your right hand, same as the ';' key, but remember not to move your hand, only the finger
Another key from this home row would be '\'. It's pressed with the pinky finger of your right hand, you should press SHIFT if you want to type it as '|'
Fingers should return to the home row after pressing each key
Fingers should return to the home row after pressing each key
And now some review exercises from the first two lessons
And now some review exercises from the first two lessons
Don't forget all the instructions we give you throughout the lesson
Don't forget all the instructions we give you throughout the lesson
Are your thumbs in position?
Remember to keep your hands in a relaxed position
Remember to keep your hands in a relaxed position
Congratulations! You have finished the second lesson

lessons.title: First part of top row
lessons.description: Learn the top row keys: Q, W, E, I, O, P

steps.description: Here begins the third lesson. We're going to start with the top row, which is what we call the row above the home row
Press the 'q' key with the pinky finger of your left hand and the 'p' key with your right hand
Type correctly twice
Now press the 'w' key with the ring finger of your left hand and the 'o' key with your right hand
Now press the 'w' key with the ring finger of your left hand and the 'o' key with your right hand
And now some exercises with the first four keys of this row
And now some exercises with the first four keys of this row
You should automatically adopt the correct posture by now
You should automatically adopt the correct posture by now
Two more keys for the middle fingers. With the left the 'e' key and with the right the 'i' key
Two more keys for the middle fingers. With the left the 'e' key and with the right the 'i' key
Don't forget the position of your thumbs on the spacebar and the rest of your fingers on the home row
Don't forget the position of your thumbs on the spacebar and the rest of your fingers on the home row
Don't move your whole hand, only the fingers that are going to press
Don't move your whole hand, only the fingers that are going to press

steps.text: qw ew io po pq ow ie
steps.description: Don't forget that the spacebar is pressed with the thumb of the hand opposite to the last key pressed

steps.text: ei wo qp op oi we wq
steps.description: Don't forget that the spacebar is pressed with the thumb of the hand opposite to the last key pressed
Don't look at the keyboard. You should only look at the screen
Don't look at the keyboard. You should only look at the screen
Don't rush. Don't hurry. You'll achieve speed in due time. Now focus on doing the exercises well
Don't rush. Don't hurry. You'll achieve speed in due time. Now focus on doing the exercises well
Congratulations! You have finished the third lesson

lessons.title: Top row
lessons.description: Learn the top row keys: Q, W, E, R, T, Y, U, I, O, P

steps.description: In this lesson we're going to learn the rest of the top row and do exercises with the two rows we already know
Press the 'r' key with the index finger of your left hand and the 'u' key with your right hand
Press the 'r' key with the index finger of your left hand and the 'u' key with your right hand
And now with the other keys we already know in this row
And now with the other keys we already know in this row

steps.text: rq up rw uo re ui
steps.description: And now with the other keys we already know in this row

steps.text: iu er ou wr pu qr
steps.description: Make sure you're pressing with the correct fingers
With the index finger of your left hand press the 't' key
With the index finger of your right hand press the 'y' key
Now some exercises
Make sure to press the keys with the correct fingers
Don't forget not to move your hands but your fingers
After each keystroke your fingers should return to their correct position
With the pinky finger of your right hand press the '[' key
With the same finger press the ']' key
Now we're going to use the SHIFT key. Press SHIFT with your left pinky finger and the '{' key with your right pinky
Remember that the SHIFT key is pressed with the hand opposite to the one that will press the main key and with the pinky fingers. With the same fingers and hands now press the '}' key
Following the previous instructions do the following exercises
Don't be impatient. This exercise is complicated if you try to do it quickly and simple if you do it relaxed
Don't be impatient. This exercise is complicated if you try to do it quickly and simple if you do it relaxed
Now you know two complete rows. The following exercises should be considered as a review of the four lessons you've done so far. We'll start with the pinkies
Now you know two complete rows. The following exercises should be considered as a review of the four lessons you've done so far. We'll start with the pinkies
With the ring fingers
With the middle fingers
With the index fingers
With the index fingers
With the index fingers
And with all...
And with all...
Press each key with the correct fingers
Press each key with the correct fingers
After each keystroke your fingers should return to their position on the home row
After each keystroke your fingers should return to their position on the home row
Your thumbs should be on the spacebar
Your thumbs should be on the spacebar
Your thumbs should be on the spacebar
Don't look at the keyboard
Don't be in a hurry
Don't be in a hurry
Position your body correctly
Position your body correctly
The palms of your hands should not rest on the table or keyboard
The palms of your hands should not rest on the table or keyboard
Don't cross your legs; you'll avoid numbness in your limbs
Now we're going to form words
Now we're going to form words
Remember that the hand position is curved and lightly touching the home row keys
Remember that the hand position is curved and lightly touching the home row keys
Your thumbs should be on the spacebar
Your thumbs should be on the spacebar
Don't look at the keyboard
Don't look at the keyboard
At this point in the course you should have the correct habits. If not, it would be advisable to review the beginner lesson
At this point in the course you should have the correct habits. If not, it would be advisable to review the beginner lesson
Congratulations! You have finished the fourth lesson

lessons.title: First part of bottom row
lessons.description: Learn part of the bottom row: Z, /, X, ., C, ,

steps.description: We're going to start with the bottom row. You already know the method and this fifth lesson will be very easy for you.
Press 'z' with the pinky finger of your left hand and the '/' key with your right hand
Press 'z' with the pinky finger of your left hand and the '/' key with your right hand
Press the 'x' key with the ring finger of your left hand and the '.' key with your right hand
Press the 'x' key with the ring finger of your left hand and the '.' key with your right hand
After each keystroke on the bottom row, your fingers should return to their key on the home row
Press the 'c' key with the middle finger of your left hand and the ',' key with your right hand
Press the 'c' key with the middle finger of your left hand and the ',' key with your right hand
Your fingers move, not your hands
Your fingers move, not your hands
Your thumbs should be on the spacebar
Your thumbs should be on the spacebar
Don't forget that the spacebar is pressed with the thumb of the hand opposite to the last key pressed
Don't forget that the spacebar is pressed with the thumb of the hand opposite to the last key pressed
Are you placing your fingers back in position after each keystroke?
Are you placing your fingers back in position after each keystroke?
Read all the explanations and tips that appear in the lessons
Congratulations! You have finished the fifth lesson

lessons.title: Bottom row
lessons.description: Learn the entire bottom row: Z, /, X, ., C, ,, V, M, B, N

steps.description: With this lesson we will complete the bottom row. Then you should do some exercises with all the keys you know
Press the 'v' key with the index finger of your left hand
Now press the 'm' key with the index finger of your right hand
Now press the 'm' key with the index finger of your right hand
Now with the same fingers press the 'b' key with your left hand and the 'n' key with your right hand
Now with the same fingers press the 'b' key with your left hand and the 'n' key with your right hand
Some exercises with the entire row
Some exercises with the entire row
Don't forget all the habits you should have acquired in previous lessons. We will remind you of them throughout this lesson
Don't forget all the habits you should have acquired in previous lessons. We will remind you of them throughout this lesson
Don't forget that the spacebar is pressed with the thumb of the hand opposite to the last key pressed
Don't forget that the spacebar is pressed with the thumb of the hand opposite to the last key pressed
Your back should be straight and your legs uncrossed
Your back should be straight and your legs uncrossed
There are only three keys left in this row, for which you need to press the SHIFT key with the pinky finger of your left hand. Then press ':' with the middle finger of your right hand
Without releasing the SHIFT key, press the '<' key with the index finger and the '_' key with the pinky finger
Without releasing the SHIFT key, press the '<' key with the index finger and the '_' key with the pinky finger
Now some review exercises with all three rows
Now some review exercises with all three rows
Pressing keys on the bottom row is done by moving the corresponding finger and returning it to its position on the home row
Pressing keys on the bottom row is done by moving the corresponding finger and returning it to its position on the home row
Keep your thumbs on the spacebar
Keep your thumbs on the spacebar
Your hands should lightly touch the keys on the home row
Your hands should lightly touch the keys on the home row
Don't be impatient. It doesn't matter if you do it slowly. What's important is that you do it well and correctly. Speed will come on its own
Don't be impatient. It doesn't matter if you do it slowly. What's important is that you do it well and correctly. Speed will come on its own
Don't be impatient. It doesn't matter if you do it slowly. What's important is that you do it well and correctly. Speed will come on its own
Don't be impatient. It doesn't matter if you do it slowly. What's important is that you do it well and correctly. Speed will come on its own
Remember that each keystroke is made with the corresponding finger
Remember that each keystroke is made with the corresponding finger
Remember that each keystroke is made with the corresponding finger
Now some words with all three rows
Now some words with all three rows
Now some words with all three rows
Now some words with all three rows
Now some words with all three rows
Now some words with all three rows
Now some words with all three rows
Now some words with all three rows

Congratulations! You have finished the sixth lesson
In this lesson we will use the number row.
With the left hand we will press the first two numbers |1| and |2|, pressing 1 with the pinky finger and 2 with the ring finger
The |3| is pressed with the middle finger, and the |4| and |5| with the index finger
The |3| is pressed with the middle finger, and the |4| and |5| with the index finger
The |3| is pressed with the middle finger, and the |4| and |5| with the index finger
The |3| is pressed with the middle finger, and the |4| and |5| with the index finger
Now we will practice with the fingers of the right hand, we will press |0| and |9| with the pinky and ring fingers respectively
We will press |8| with the middle finger and |7| and |6| with the index finger
We will press |8| with the middle finger and |7| and |6| with the index finger
We will press |8| with the middle finger and |7| and |6| with the index finger
We will press |8| with the middle finger and |7| and |6| with the index finger
Now we will use both hands, remembering that each index finger is used for two numbers
Now we will use both hands, remembering that each index finger is used for two numbers
